Title: BP commits to taking all of Woodfibre LNG’s output with a third offtake deal
Description: BP has signed a third offtake agreement with Canada’s Woodfibre LNG, giving it offtake rights to all the LNG output from the 2.1 mtpa project in British Columbia.
Author: CK

Title: Wheatstone employees offer to work during upcoming strike amid domestic gas plant trip
Description: Employees at Chevron’s downstream Wheatstone facility in Western Australia have offered to work during the upcoming notified period of protected industrial action in response to a shutdown at the facility's domestic gas plant.
Author: CK

Title: Shell says Venture Global’s actions damage trust in long-term LNG contracts
Description: Shell has called out US project developer Venture Global for the much-delayed start to commercial operations at its 10 mtpa Calcasieu Pass project, saying such a move damages trust in long-term contracts and potentially hampers the signing of new term contracts and the growth of the LNG industry.
Author: CK

Title: Europe is exposed to LNG market volatility without more long-term contracts: Kpler
Description: The vacuum left by Russia’s curtailment of pipeline gas supplies to Europe has presented opportunities for long-term LNG contracting that have become prominent, especially with buyers having secured a higher number of longer-duration contracts in 2022 compared to 2021, lead gas and LNG analyst at Kpler, Eleni Papadopoulou, said during the Gastech conference in Singapore today.
Author: CK

Title: Chevron workers extend strike action until Sep. 29; complete work stoppage for 14 days
Description: Employees at the onshore Gorgon and Wheatstone facilities and offshore Wheatstone platform in Western Australia have escalated their pay dispute with Chevron, extending the duration of their planned strike action at the facilities by two weeks to Sep. 29 with work stoppages of up to 24 hours a day that would halt exports from the 8.9 mtpa Wheatstone and 15.6 mtpa Gorgon LNG facilities.
Author: CK
